title: 111_s2901
content:
The Act titled "Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act of 2009" establishes the Government-Wide Acquisition Management Fellows Program under the Office of Federal Procurement Policy Act. The Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act of 2009 establishes a government-wide acquisition management fellows program to invest in the long-term improvement of the Federal acquisition workforce. The program aims to develop new acquisition leaders, recruit individuals with academic merit and leadership skills, and provide advancement opportunities at executive agencies. The government-wide acquisition management fellows program aims to offer advancement opportunities, competitive compensation, and leadership roles at executive agencies upon completion. The program includes one year of on-campus training followed by two years of on-the-job training towards a Masters degree. Curriculum elements involve rotational assignments at multiple executive agencies focusing on acquisition planning and contract administration. The government-wide acquisition management fellows program includes rotational assignments at multiple executive agencies covering acquisition planning, cost estimation, contract administration, and other necessary courses. Graduates of the program receive priority for employment at executive agencies. The government-wide acquisition management fellows program prioritizes graduates for employment in executive agencies, appointing them to positions at the GS-12, 13, or 14 levels. The total number of program participants each year is limited to 200, with a minimum of 50 participants. The government-wide acquisition management fellows program limits the total number of participants to 200 per year, with a minimum of 50 participants in the first year and increasing to 100 in the second year. The program is managed by the Administrator, who enters into agreements with qualified universities, oversees the program, and places individuals upon graduation. Universities select and remove participants based on academic processes. The government-wide acquisition management fellows program limits participants to 200 per year, managed by the Administrator. Universities select and remove participants based on academic processes. Program participants commit to federal employment in acquisition for a term equal to their program duration. The government-wide acquisition management fellows program, limited to 200 participants per year, is managed by the Administrator. Participants commit to federal employment in acquisition for a term equal to their program duration. If candidates do not complete the program or meet service requirements, they must reimburse the government for funds received. The OFPP Acquisition Fellows Program Fund is established to cover program expenses, including tuition and materials. The OFPP Acquisition Fellows Program Fund will be used for program operations, awarding contracts, grants, and expenses such as tuition, room and board, travel, stipends, planning, and administration. The Fund consists of appropriated or available amounts. The Administrator will submit reports on the government-wide acquisition management fellows program, including a preliminary report within 120 days of enactment and annual reports thereafter. Reports will detail program activities, participant numbers, training provided, and effectiveness assessment. The committees will receive a report on the government-wide acquisition management fellows program, detailing program activities, participant numbers, training provided, effectiveness assessment, and any recommendations for legislative or administrative action. The appropriate congressional committees include the Senate Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs, Senate Committee on Appropriations, House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform, and House Committee on Appropriations. Authorization of Appropriations for the OFPP Acquisition Fellows Development Fund:
- For fiscal year 2011: $16,000,000
- For fiscal year 2012: $32,000,000
- For fiscal year 2013: $48,000,000

Relevant committees for oversight: 
- Senate Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs
- Senate Committee on Appropriations
- House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
- House Committee on Appropriations
